content: I think I'll go with "The Essential New York Times Cookbook" by Amanda Hesser. I've heard great things about it and it seems like a versatile cookbook that will give her a lot of recipe options. For a kitchen gadget, I'm thinking of getting her a silicone baking mat. I've heard it's really useful for baking cookies and other treats. Do you think it's a good idea to get a set of silicone baking mats in different sizes, or just one large one?
